definition: a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to lend on interest/to borrow/a loan/leniency/to make excuses/to pardon/to forgive
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)
loan on favorable terms/concessionary loan/soft loan

pinyin: di3 ya1 dai4 kuan3 wei1 ji1
ci4 ji2 di3 ya1 dai4 kuan3

definition: subprime lending/abbr. to 次貸|次贷
demand loan (i.e. loan that the borrower can demanded back at any time)

sentences.english: Unlike those of the West, Chinese loans are "no strings attached."
sentences.chinese: 不象西方国家，中国的贷款是“无附带条件”。

sentences.english: At the same time, banks in Western Europe are neck-deep in shaky loans to these countries.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，西欧银行的贷款也深陷新兴市场国家。

sentences.english: At present, China's commercial banks is also difficult to accurately estimate the expected loss of non-lending.
sentences.chinese: 目前，我国商业银行还难以准确估算贷款非预期损失。

sentences.english: For developers, there is no evidence of property rights will not be able to bank loans.
sentences.chinese: 对于开发商来说，没有产权证就无法向银行贷款。

sentences.english: But he still thinks that the loans are a good idea.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他仍然认为进行贷款救助是一个好办法。

sentences.english: Most of these loans have not yet been used, or drawn down.
sentences.chinese: 这些贷款的大部分还没有被使用或入资。

sentences.english: The loan money will be used in the inner decoration.
sentences.chinese: 申请的贷款将用于室内装潢。

sentences.english: Yet evidence abounds that banks are still gun-shy about lending to business.
sentences.chinese: 但是诸多证据显示银行对企业贷款仍是小心翼翼。

sentences.english: Banks are not lining up to lend money on their own for construction of the newest generation of Indian Points.
sentences.chinese: 银行不会自愿贷款给新一代印点核电站的建造。

sentences.english: Ask your student-loan servicer to extend your payback period.
sentences.chinese: 请求你的学生贷款商延长你的还款期限。

sentences.english: Did you ever require a cosigner for a loan?
sentences.chinese: 你是否曾经有过一个贷款担保人？

sentences.english: At that point, I decided for him and chose to utilize the loan renewal clause.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上，我决定为他选择了利用贷款续期的条文。

sentences.english: But Georgia banks blew themselves up with old-fashioned loans gone bad.
sentences.chinese: 但乔治亚州的银行却因老式贷款坏账而引爆自身。

sentences.english: Others are chock full of loans, which must be re-paid.
sentences.chinese: 而有些呢，全部是贷款，总要还的。

sentences.english: NO10,5. What is the interest rate on this loan?
sentences.chinese: 这个贷款的利率是多少？

definition: to lend money (as a commercial loan)
a mortgage (loanword via Cantonese)/to buy property on a mortgage
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to lend on interest/to borrow/a loan/leniency/to make excuses/to pardon/to forgive
